Key Match Events: Jos Buttler became a supernova and scored 86* in just 8.3 overs
Alex Hales became a dream come true and scored 80* in just 8.3 overs
Jos Buttler and Alex Hales put on a 170-run partnership in just 15.3 overs
India's death overs were phenomenal with 58 runs coming in 4 overs
Rohit Sharma's helicopter shot over midwicket boundary was sublime
Pre-Game Insights: England will bowl first as they want to take advantage of the Adelaide Oval's short boundaries
India will bat first as they want to exploit the long boundaries
England's selection question is around the fitness of Mark Wood
India's selection question is around whether to pick Dinesh Karthik or Rishabh Pant
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler said that this win was all about doing the basics right
Alex Hales said that he was thrilled to be a part of this team and to have contributed to the win
Hardik Pandya said that India's death overs were phenomenal and that they had a good chance of winning the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at the Adelaide Oval, which has a history of producing high-scoring matches
The average total in T20s at the Adelaide Oval since 2020 is 161
The team that has won the toss at the Adelaide Oval in this tournament has always gone on to lose the match
Virat Kohli is the top run-scorer in this tournament, while Suryakumar Yadav is the top run-scorer in the year
Arshdeep Singh is climbing up the top wicket-takers list
Others: The article mentions that India's best weapon, Jasprit Bumrah, was injured and out of the tournament before the game
The article mentions that the World Cup has not been held in India since 2011
The article mentions that England is just two wins away from being the first men's team in history to hold both World Cups at the same time
